title: bashargparse - Bash Implementation of argparse
description: Create a bash implementation of Python's argparse library with focus on simplicity and 80/20 core features. Must be easy to import and use.

stories.title: Create core library structure with simple sourcing
stories.description: Create bashargparse.sh as the main library file. Must be sourceable with a single 'source bashargparse.sh' command. Set up internal state variables for storing argument definitions.

stories.title: Implement argparse_init function
stories.description: Create argparse_init() that initializes the parser with optional program name and description. Should be called once at the start. Example: argparse_init 'myprogram' 'Description of my program'

stories.title: Implement add_argument for boolean flags
stories.description: Implement add_argument for simple boolean flags (store_true). Support both short (-v) and long (--verbose) forms. Example: add_argument -s v -l verbose -h 'Enable verbose mode'

stories.title: Implement add_argument for value flags
stories.description: Extend add_argument to support flags that take values. Support default values. Example: add_argument -s o -l output -d '/tmp/out' -h 'Output file'

stories.title: Implement add_argument for positional arguments
stories.description: Extend add_argument to support positional arguments (no dash prefix). Example: add_argument -p filename -h 'Input file to process'

stories.title: Implement argparse_parse function
stories.description: Create argparse_parse() that parses $@ and populates result variables. Should handle: boolean flags, value flags, positional args, unknown args. Create accessible variables like $ARG_VERBOSE, $ARG_OUTPUT, etc.

stories.title: Implement automatic --help generation
stories.description: Auto-generate --help / -h that displays program name, description, and all arguments with their help text in a nicely formatted way. Exit after displaying help.

stories.title: Implement required flag validation
stories.description: Add -r/--required option to add_argument. During parse, validate that required arguments are provided. Print error and usage if missing.

stories.title: Implement type validation (int)
stories.description: Add -t/--type option to add_argument supporting 'int' type. Validate during parse that value is numeric. Print error if validation fails.

stories.title: Implement choices validation
stories.description: Add -c/--choices option to add_argument. Validate during parse that value is one of the allowed choices. Example: add_argument -l level -c 'debug,info,warn,error'

stories.title: Implement count action for flags
stories.description: Add support for count action where flag can be repeated (-vvv = 3). Add -a/--action option to add_argument with 'count' value.

stories.title: Implement nargs for multiple values
stories.description: Add -n/--nargs option supporting '+' (one or more), '*' (zero or more), and numbers. Store results as space-separated string or array.

stories.title: Create comprehensive demo script
stories.description: Create examples/demo.sh that demonstrates all bashargparse features. Include comments explaining each feature. Show both simple and advanced usage patterns.

stories.title: Document limitations vs Python argparse
stories.description: Add a LIMITATIONS section to the demo script output that clearly lists what's different/missing compared to Python argparse (subcommands, argument groups, mutually exclusive groups, etc.)

stories.title: Create README with usage examples
stories.description: Create README.md with: quick start, installation, API reference, examples, and link to demo script. Focus on showing how simple it is to use.
